titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Mackenzie Bell Papers LSC.0705
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yvonne Schroeder, January 1961, additions by Esther Vécsey; machine-readable finding aid created by Alight Tsai.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-13 15:53:20 -0700.

did.abstract: Mackenzie Bell (1856-1930) published numerous books, articles and poems. The collection contains holograph manuscripts, notebooks, correspondence, pictures, and related ephemera. Includes holograph manuscripts of Spring's Immortality and Other Poems, Pictures of Travel and Other Poems, and William Morris, Poet and Socialist, as I Knew Him. Also contains materials relating to the Rossettis, Algernon Swinburne, Theodore Watts-Dunton, William Morris, and Charles Whitehead.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchssed from W.P. Wreden, 1962, 1975. Purchased from Winifred Myers, 1964.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mackenzie Bell Papers (Collection 705). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Yvonne Schroeder, January 1961. Additions processed by Esther Vécsey.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Mackenzie Bell was born in 1856 in Liverpool, England; he settled in London in 1884; the same year saw the publication of his book, Charles Whitehead: A Forgotten Genius; wrote critical articles for Academy, Speaker, Temple Bar and other publications; became a member of the Reform Club; other published works include Verses of Varied Life (1882), Spring's Immortality: and Other Poems (1893), and Christina Rossetti: A Biographical and Critical Study; he died in 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains holograph manuscripts, notebooks, correspondence, pictures, and related ephemera. Includes holograph manuscript of Spring's Immortality and Other Poems, Pictures of Travel and Other Poems, and William Morris, Poet and Socialist, as I Knew Him. Also contains author's copy of collected poems, books about Christina Rossetti and Charles Whitehead, and a typescript of Swinburne and his poetry, with holographs of William Morris. Also contains materials relating to the Rossettis, Algernon Swinburne, Theodore Watts-Dunton, William Morris, and Charles Whitehead.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Manuscripts and first editions of poems.
Author's copy of his books on Christina Rossetti and Charles Whitehead, and typescript of book on Algernon Charles Swinburne.
Miscellaneous manuscripts, photographs and ephemera.
Illustrations, etchings and reproductions.
Correspondence.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
Picture Collection (Collection 99). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.
Collier, John. Richard Garnett. [London (?), ca. 1900] Photograph, mounted. (In Coll. ORIG. 99) 1 item. 22.5 × 18cm.

did.unittitle: Spring's Immortality. Published by Ward, Lock, and Bowden, Limited, London,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Author's copy. 2nd edition with some holograph revisions in preparation for next edition.

did.unittitle: Spring's Immortality and Other Poems. n.p.,
did.physdesc: Holograph manuscript. Bound in blue cloth.

did.unittitle: Poems. Working copy vol.16. Published by Clark, London,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Author's copy with programs, brochures, letters, notes, etc. attached and inserted throughout book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Author's copy with holograph annotations and letters, notes, miscellaneous ephemera attached and inserted throughout book. First page lists poems that have been recited.

did.unittitle: Manuscript of poems between 1898 and 1909. n.p.,
did.physdesc: Bound in half calf and green cloth covers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mostly holograph with pages of typescript, annotated proofs of published poems, and newspaper and magazine clippings of his published poems and articles with holograph notations, interspersed.

did.unittitle: Pictures Of Travel and Other Poems.
Pictures of Travel and Other Poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First leaf reads To a worker among the poor and other poems with final title penciled in below.

Pictures of Travel and Other Poems. Published by Hurst and Blackett Limited, London,
Pictures of Travel and Other Poems.
Christina Rossetti. Published by Hurst and Blackett Limited, London,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Author's copy with copious holograph notes in ink, in preparation for revised edition. Note to the printer on first leaf.

did.physdesc: 4 items. Mostly bound in half calf and marbled boards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diaries with occasional letters and miscellaneous pieces of ephemera inserted.

did.unittitle: A Forgotten Genius: Charles Whitehead. London, Elliot Stock,
did.physdesc: Unbound. Most of the pages are cut into three parts and mounted separately on white paper.

did.unittitle: Extract from an article about Whitehead by James Smith.... Holograph copy from direct transfer. Published in The Australian,
School Recitations. London: James Clark & Company,
Poems of Nature. London: James Clark & Company,
Poems of Consolation and of Religion. London: James Clark & Company, ,

did.physdesc: Typescript and mimeograph with corrections. 3 items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes short, incomplete manuscripts of articles, poems, etc., and some corrected and revised printed matter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings, magazine articles, pamphlets, brochures, broadsides etc.

did.unittitle: Engraved steel blocks of The Heart's Summer, Holy Quietude, and Lyrics of Consolation.
Framed photograph of Mackenzie Bell and his sister Mary Elizabeth and Maggie, dated
Photographs of friends and acquaintances including prominent literary figures etc.
Illustrations for Christina Rossetti. Mounted reproductiohs of drawings etc.
Original ink sketches for Pictures of Travel.
Two framed, original etchings by Dante Gabriel Rossetti, 1894 and one framed reproduction of poem by Theodore Watts-Dunton, , presented and signed by Watts-Dunton to Bell.
Three mounted and one framed reproductions of drawings and paintings owned by Christina Rossetti until her death.

list.item: Also: one mounted photograph of her funeral, all presented to Bell by William Rossetti.
Also: photograph of family grave given to M.B. from Lisa Wilson. January 6, 1898.

did.unittitle: Framed oil sketck of William MacDonald Sinclair by William Lockhart,
Reminiscences of Liszt, by George Liebling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written on Back of identical mimeographed publicity letters announcing Liebling's availability for the coming concert season and signed by his secretary, January 1900.

did.unittitle: William Morris, Poet and Socialist, as I Knew Him. n.p.,
did.physdesc: Holograph and mimeograph with extensive ink notations.

did.unittitle: Three pages of proof corrected in ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With attached note: "Some sheets of Mrs. Henry Wood's Dene Hollow given to me at my request by Dr. Japp, September 15, 1893."

did.unittitle: Correspondence and related ephemera from friends and literary figures, mostly addressed to Bell.
Correspondence and documents for the year 1891, with a few letters dated

list.item: Much of this material relates to the death of Bell's mother in 1891. Correspondents include Douglas Sladen and Theodore Watts-Dunton.
Also included are copies of Bell's letters.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Separate purchase from Winifred Myers, London, August 1964.
